text:
Raskolnikov sat in a tavern, lost in thought. 

He had just left the pawnbroker, Alyona Ivanovna. 

Repulsion gripped him at the memory of her face. 

Two roubles sat heavy in his pocket. 

A student and an officer laughed at the next table. 

“Have you heard of Alyona Ivanovna?” the student asked. 

Raskolnikov perked up. 

“She’s first-rate,” the student continued. 

“She’ll give you five thousand roubles, no problem.” 

“But she’s an awful old harpy,” he added, chuckling. 

Raskolnikov listened, a strange feeling stirring inside him. 

The student described her greed, her spite. 

Raskolnikov’s mind raced. 

He stared at his tea, the weight of the ring heavy in his thoughts.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels a strange connection to the pawnbroker Alyona Ivanovna after overhearing a conversation about her at a tavern.
